reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff here are excellent, so friendly, helpful and attentive, Rooms are clean, well furnished and comfortable. Although the location requires a drive to get to a restaurant, it is great for motorway access and the airport. We ate in the bar, and the food was ok but not special and did regret not booking a table in the restaurant. Try and book in advance or look out for offers as we went on a late offer and got a great price.
reviews.title: A comfortable and relaxing stay

reviews.text: Had a lovely stay at the Hilton in one of their newly refurbished rooms. Went for work and very convenient. Staff were very friendly and it was National Egg week while there. Delicious food and enjoyed the spa/swimming pool which also had helpful staff. Great flat screen TV in room but very hot duvet cover. All in all would definitely recommend for a short break... if you're going to Eastleigh anyway!
reviews.title: Good service, friendly staff and comfortable rooms, what more do you want

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Hilton months in advance and paid upfront, so got an amazing deal - £60 in total for the two of us including breakfast!! Car parking is £3 a day - annoying hotels now do this and gets you off on the wrong note at the start as you check in - the car park is large, and, despite a wedding going on there were still spaces, so it appeared to just be a 'greed' charge by the Hilton.
reviews.title: Excellent value, good location, proper feather duvets ie ideal for pre cruise stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in room 2008 on level 2 just around from the leisure centre. Good sized room, a little gloomy as it overlooked trees at the back of the hotel but it was quiet and wonderfully cool - it was a scorcher of a day the night we stayed. With the windows open you could hear distant traffic but we slept very well.
reviews.title: 10 OUT OF 10 GREAT HOTEL

reviews.text: The duvet covers were a little worn but it seemed to be a weave design fault, not old age, as it was only on the embossed cotton part. The duvets and pillows were wonderful - proper feather ones - so comfortable and lovely and cool to sleep under!
reviews.title: Tired property, tired staff.

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night on business. I usually hang out in Express By Holiday Inn, Jury's Inn etc but chose to stay here due to the half price January sale - it worked out cheaper than the others.
reviews.title: Not as bad as some reviews make out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was fast, friendly and hassle free. I was in my standard double room within around 5 minutes of parking my car.
reviews.title: discredit to the name hilton

reviews.text: I agree that the rooms seem tired and dated, but mine was perfectly clean, bed reasonably comfortable and everything worked. The power shower was excellent. Tiny towels though.
reviews.title: Dreadful...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had room service which took around 40 mins to arrive. The food was average, and as usual for room service, way overpriced for what you get.
reviews.title: Another run down Hilton.

reviews.text: My room had a large flat screen TV, which was great for watching from bed.
reviews.title: Waste of money - may as well have been the Premier Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The title sounds gushing, that's because many previous reviews, IMHO, were very unfair.
reviews.title: Ideal hotel for business or pleasure with excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights in March and used most of their services, and apart from some small attention to detail, we could not fault the hotel. If the hotel corrected the detail issues, frankly, it would be in a different price bracket.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in a handy location

reviews.text: The useful things to know are:- 1. No AC in rooms. But to us, in winter, this was a plus, as the radiator could be finely adjusted up or down without any annoying AC drafts or fan noises. 2. Parking is £3 per day, which strangely is not mentioned anywhere!
reviews.title: Thought it was ok

reviews.text: We didn't find the restaurant expensive - £15.50 for a two course set menu which included a peppered sirlion steak is fine by us. It's not Michelin food, but it's well prepared, nicely presented and with good quality ingredients - and we think good value for money.
reviews.title: Don't eat or drink there but nice hotel otherwise !

reviews.text: The small issues were:- 1. Wifi is one single BT Openzone node, which wasn't working all the time we were there - some redundancy is surely required! However, my 3 Mobile Broadband dongle worked perfectly throughout the hotel. 2. Bill needs to be checked - my pre-payment was entered incorrectly to the wrong folio, and the counter balancing room rate was wrong - fixed immediately, but careless! 3. Breakfast service could be improved - self-service area was not cleaned and replenished promptly.
reviews.title: Pretty allright for short stay

reviews.text: Stayed several nights in this Hotel. Parking was usually a nightmare as the car park was generally crowded.. The room was adequate but hardly deserving of it's "Deluxe" label particularly in view of the facilities on offer. Internet access was classed as an "extra". The bathroom looked tired and the noise of the plumbing from neighbouring rooms was intrusive. Breakfast was fine although extremely crowded. The restauarant staff made the experience tolerable. You need to be aware that the hotel is noisy due to the close proximity of adjoining roads so sleeping with the window open was not practicable. Does not compare well with other hotels in the same chain. Expensive for what was provided and will not stay here again
reviews.title: Not what we expected from the Hilton brand

reviews.text: I stayed in the hotel for my 10 year wedding anniversary sat 15th August till the 17th the reception staff were slow and too busy chatting to attend to us the room 521 was extremely hot and after commenting on this we were told it was the boilers above are room. The room was dated and smelt of stale cigerettes. Breakfast was a self service buffet which was ok but when we asked for coffee took nearly 15mins to arrive. That night we went to the bar and had to wait ages for a member of staff to arrive we also saw other people so frustrated by the wait help themselfs by leaning over the bar and poring there own drinks from the beer taps. rain water was also poring though the light fittings in the main main fishtank area.The pond area needs attention as the bridge over was unsafe due to the wood being rotten. The walk ways aloneside the lesuire centre had lose pavment slabs.We used the swimming pool facilitys but the steam room was out of order. On the whole i wish i had never booked my stay there i have seen better travel lodges it completely ruined my aniversery. I will NOT be recommending this hotel and letting all my friends know how terrible it was 0/10 DO NOT VISIT THIS HOTEL!
reviews.title: Worst hotel in the UK (Do not go there)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room here in March for my partner's birthday and we had absolutely no complaints, in fact we had such a good time my partner proposedthat weekend. We married this month and could only manage 2 days honeymoon so decided to use Hilton Southampton as a base for Bournemouth etc. We advised the hotel of these facts in advance and within 5 minutes of arrival housekeeping knocked on door with congratulations, extra towels and asking if there was anything else we needed. We had complimentary drinks vouchers on both nights so had 2 pints, 2 spirits and mixers for free. Breakfast was again lovely. Housekeeping and restaurant and bar staff were all very friendly unfortunately the whole experience is let down by the front of house staff who seem more interested in paperwork than people and have forgotten how to smile and its also a shame about £3 car parking fee.
reviews.title: Wonderful and considerate

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night before our cruise. Before going to bed I placed an expensive watch and bracelet on the dressing table. Next morning we had breakfast, packed our bags, scanned the room for any belongings and left. Once on the ship one of my children asked me the time, I looked down at my wrist and saw that I hadn't put my watch or bracelet on. They were definately not on the dressing table after breakfast and in my haste (with 18 month old baby sharing room) I had not even thought about it missing. We phoned the Hilton immediately and they rang back informing us that nothing had been found I was devastated and it ruined the start of my first cruise. Returning 2 weeks later we returned to the Hilton where we spoke to a very uncompassionate housekeeper who said there was no case to investigate because we had no evidence and had we contacted our insurance company! Obviously the police are involved and now I am home I will pursue the matter further.
reviews.title: do not leave anything valuable in your room - it may be stolen!
Poor service, food and rooms
reviews.text: A very disappointing work trip starting with poor service on arrival. The bathroom was substandard which was in need of updating. The hairdyer broke when using, then worked, then broke again, then worked. The window broke upon opening and fell off the top hinges. The walls appeared to be made of paper. The evening meal was not particularly nice and the service was not particularly attentive.
